description:
Control and monitor smart home devices.

This is a list of available devices, with a domain on each line followed by the names of all devices in that domain. You MUST use only the names of devices found in this list for Hass tool calls. You MAY infer which name the user is referring to from context, if appropriate.
binary_sensor: Movement Backyard
climate: Ecobee, HeatPump, Hvac
cover: Garage Door, Hall Window, Kitchen Window, Living Room Window, Pergola Roof
fan: Ceiling Fan, Living Room Fan, Percentage Full Fan, Percentage Limited Fan, Preset Only Limited Fan
humidifier: Dehumidifier, Humidifier, Hygrostat
light: Bed Light, Ceiling Lights, Entrance Color + White Lights, Kitchen Lights, Living Room RGBWW Lights, Office RGBW Lights
media_player: Bedroom, Browse, Group, Kitchen, Living Room, Lounge room, Search, Walkman
sensor: Carbon dioxide, Carbon monoxide, Outside Humidity, Outside Temperature
switch: AC, Decorative Lights
todo: Shopping List
vacuum: Demo vacuum 0 ground floor, Demo vacuum 1 first floor, Demo vacuum 2 second floor, Demo vacuum 3 third floor, Demo vacuum 4 fourth floor
water_heater: Demo Water Heater, Demo Water Heater Celsius
weather: Forecast Home

functions.name: HassTurnOn
functions.description: Turns on/opens/presses a device or entity. For locks, this performs a 'lock' action. Use for requests like 'turn on', 'activate', 'enable', or 'lock'.

functions.name: HassTurnOff
functions.description: Turns off/closes a device or entity. For locks, this performs an 'unlock' action. Use for requests like 'turn off', 'deactivate', 'disable', or 'unlock'.

functions.name: HassSetPosition
functions.description: Sets the position of a device or entity

functions.name: HassCancelAllTimers
functions.description: Cancels all timers

functions.name: HassListAddItem
functions.description: Add item to a todo list

functions.name: HassClimateSetTemperature
functions.description: Sets the target temperature of a climate device or entity

functions.name: HassFanSetSpeed
functions.description: Sets a fan's speed by percentage

percentage.description: The speed percentage of the fan (minimum: 0) (maximum: 100)

functions.name: HassHumidifierSetpoint
functions.description: Set desired humidity level

functions.name: HassLightSet
functions.description: Sets the brightness percentage or color of a light

brightness.description: The brightness percentage of the light between 0 and 100, where 0 is off and 100 is fully lit (minimum: 0) (maximum: 100)

functions.name: HassMediaUnpause
functions.description: Resumes a media player

functions.name: HassMediaPause
functions.description: Pauses a media player

functions.name: HassMediaNext
functions.description: Skips a media player to the next item

functions.name: HassMediaPrevious
functions.description: Replays the previous item for a media player

functions.name: HassSetVolume
functions.description: Sets the volume percentage of a media player

volume_level.description: The volume percentage of the media player (minimum: 0) (maximum: 100)

functions.name: HassSetVolumeRelative
functions.description: Increases or decreases the volume of a media player

functions.name: HassMediaPlayerMute
functions.description: Mutes a media player

functions.name: HassMediaPlayerUnmute
functions.description: Unmutes a media player

functions.name: HassMediaSearchAndPlay
functions.description: Searches for media and plays the first result

functions.name: HassVacuumStart
functions.description: Starts a vacuum

functions.name: HassVacuumReturnToBase
functions.description: Returns a vacuum to base

functions.name: GetDateTime
functions.description: Provides the current date and time.

functions.name: todo_get_items
functions.description: Query a to-do list to find out what items are on it. Use this to answer questions like 'What's on my task list?' or 'Read my grocery list'. Filters items by status (needs_action, completed, all).

functions.name: GetLiveContext
functions.description: Provides real-time information about the CURRENT state, value, or mode of devices, sensors, entities, or areas. Use this tool for: 1. Answering questions about current conditions (e.g., 'Is the light on?'). 2. As the first step in conditional actions (e.g., 'If the weather is rainy, turn off sprinklers' requires checking the weather first).
